item.text: The Lord spoke to Jeremiah early in the reign of Josiah’s son, King Zedekiah of Judah.
The Lord told me, “Make a yoke out of leather straps and wooden crossbars and put it on your neck.

Use it to <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> messages <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="0123" class="">Edom</st>, <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, <st data-num="01121 05983">Ammon</st>, <st data-num="06865" class="">Tyre</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06721" class="">Sidon</st>.<n id="2" /> Send them <st data-num="03027" class="">through</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="04397" class="">envoys</st> who have <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.
Charge them to give their masters a message from me. Tell them, ‘The Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, says to give your masters this message:

“<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st> and the <st data-num="0120" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="0929 0834">animals</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="06440 0776">it</st> by my <st data-num="01419" class="">mighty</st> <st data-num="03581" class="">power</st> and <st data-num="05186" class="">great</st> <st data-num="02220" class="">strength</st>,<n id="1" /> and I <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> it to <st data-num="0834" class="">whomever</st> I <st data-num="05869" class="">see</st> <st data-num="03474" class="">fit</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> have <st data-num="06258" class="">at this time</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">placed</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">nations</st> of yours under the <st data-num="03027" class="">power</st><n id="1" /> of my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05019" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>. I have <st data-num="01571" class="">even</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> all the <st data-num="07704" class="">wild</st> <st data-num="02416" class="">animals</st> <st data-num="05647" class="">subject to</st> him.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> must <st data-num="05647" class="">serve</st> him and his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> and <st data-num="01121 01121">grandson</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="06256" class="">time</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">comes</st> for his <st data-num="01571 01931">own</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">nation</st> to fall.<n id="2" /> Then <st data-num="07227" class="">many</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> and <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> will in turn <st data-num="05647" class="">subjugate</st> Babylon.<n id="3" />

But suppose a nation or a kingdom will not be subject to King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon. Suppose it will not submit to the yoke of servitude to him. I, the Lord, affirm that I will punish that nation. I will use the king of Babylon to punish it with war, starvation, and disease until I have destroyed it.

So do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0859 08085">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="05030" class="">prophets</st> or <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> those who claim to <st data-num="07080" class="">predict the future by divination</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">by</st> <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">by</st> <st data-num="06049" class="">consulting the dead</st>,<n id="2" /> or <st data-num="0413" class="">by</st> <st data-num="03786" class="">practicing magic</st>. <st data-num="0834 01992">They</st> keep <st data-num="0559 0413 0559">telling</st> you, ‘You do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> need to <st data-num="05647" class="">be subject to</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.’

Do not listen to them,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">their</st> <st data-num="05012" class="">prophecies</st> are <st data-num="08267" class="">lies</st>.<n id="2" /> Listening <st data-num="04616" class="">to</st> them will only <st data-num="04616" class="">cause</st> you<n id="3" /> to be <st data-num="07368" class="">taken far away</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> your <st data-num="0127" class="">native land</st>. I will <st data-num="05080" class="">drive</st> you <st data-num="05080" class="">out</st> of your country and you will <st data-num="06" class="">die</st> in exile.<n id="4" />

Things will go better for the nation that submits to the yoke of servitude to the king of Babylon and is subject to him. I will leave that nation in its native land. Its people can continue to farm it and live in it. I, the Lord, affirm it!”’”
I told King Zedekiah of Judah the same thing. I said, “Submit to the yoke of servitude to the king of Babylon. Be subject to him and his people. Then you will continue to live.
There is no reason why you and your people should die in war or from starvation or disease. That’s what the Lord says will happen to any nation that will not be subject to the king of Babylon.

‘Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="01697 05030">prophets</st> who are <st data-num="0559 0413 0559">telling</st> you that you do <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> need to <st data-num="05647" class="">serve</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesying</st> <st data-num="08267" class="">lies</st> to you.

For I, the Lord, affirm that I did not send them. They are prophesying lies to you in my name. If you listen to them, I will drive you and the prophets who are prophesying lies out of the land and you will all die in exile.’”

I also told the priests and all the people, “The Lord says, ‘Do not listen to what your prophets are saying. They are prophesying to you that the valuable articles taken from the Lord’s temple will be brought back from Babylon very soon. But they are prophesying a lie to you.

Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them. <st data-num="05647" class="">Be subject to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>. Then you<n id="1" /> will <st data-num="02421" class="">continue to live</st>. <st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> should <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">be made</st> a <st data-num="02723" class="">pile of rubble</st>?’”<n id="2" />

I also told them, “If they are really prophets and the Lord is speaking to them, let them pray earnestly to the Lord of Heaven’s Armies. Let them plead with him not to let the valuable articles that are still left in the Lord’s temple, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem be taken away to Babylon.

For the Lord of Heaven’s Armies has already spoken about the two bronze pillars, the large bronze basin called ‘The Sea,’ and the movable bronze stands. He has already spoken about the rest of the valuable articles that are left in this city.

He has already spoken about these things <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05019" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">take away</st> when he <st data-num="01540" class="">carried</st> <st data-num="03079" class="">Jehoiakim’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03204" class="">Jeconiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and the <st data-num="03605 02715">nobles</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> <st data-num="01540">away as captives</st> from <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> to <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.<n id="1" />
Indeed, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, has already spoken about the valuable articles that are left in the Lord’s temple, in the royal palace of Judah, and in Jerusalem.

He has said, ‘They will be carried off to Babylon. They will remain there until it is time for me to show consideration for them again. Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place. I, the Lord, affirm this!’
